questions.question: What are the two basic requirements tested in the citizenship test?
options: Knowledge of Canada and language skills in English or French
Language skills and physical presence in Canada
Knowledge of laws and Canadian symbols only
questions.explanation: The citizenship test examines: 1) knowledge of Canada and of the rights and responsibilities of citizenship, and 2) adequate knowledge of English or French.

questions.question: What happens at the citizenship ceremony?
options: Take the Oath of Citizenship, sign the oath form, and receive the Canadian Citizenship Certificate
questions.explanation: At the ceremony, you will take the Oath of Citizenship, sign the oath form, and receive your Canadian Citizenship Certificate.

questions.question: What age group does NOT need to write the citizenship test?
options: Adult applicants 55 years of age and over
All adults must take the test
questions.explanation: Adult applicants 55 years of age and over do not need to write the citizenship test.

questions.question: What is Canada's position on gender equality?
options: Men have more rights than women
Women have more rights than men
Men and women are equal under the law
questions.explanation: In Canada, men and women are equal under the law.
